description: Welcome to the official Linkedin page for McHenry County College (MCC)! MCC is a leading community college, located in McHenry County, offering both credit programs and non-credit continuing & professional education. Visit www.mchenry.edu today.
name: McHenry County College
tagline: Our focus is on learning. Student success is our goal.

updates.text:
Did you know you can take a guided walking tour of MCC's new Foglia Center for Advanced Technology and Innovation (CATI)? This tour lets you preview our skilled trade programs while exploring the building’s state-of-the-art labs, classrooms with the latest industry-standard technology and equipment, and collaborative spaces with the Griffin Museum of Science and Industry. 
Tours are available on November 19 and 26, December 17, and January 7, 14, 21, and 28, all at 5:30 p.m. Registration is encouraged but not mandatory. Register today at https://lnkd.in/gAXT7izh.
#CATI #Robotics #Mechatronics #HVAC #CNCMachining

Illinois Community College Board Workforce Training Grant funds can offset the cost of training by 50% for eligible McHenry County businesses and nonprofit organizations (Government agencies excluded). Contact us at talentimpact@mchenry.edu or (815) 455-8593 for details. 
#WorkforceTraining #NonprofitTraining #SkillsDevelopment

MCC is searching for a Piano accompanist for the production of Legally Blonde. Auditions are December 9, 10, and 12 from 6-9 p.m. Rehearsals will start on January 13 on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 6- 9:30 p.m. and possibly some Sundays. Tech week is March 2-6.
Ten performances:  March 7, 8, 9, 14, 15, 16 (two shows), 21, 22, 23.
Compensation will be negotiable based on the candidate’s experience, recommendations, and availability to play for all of the above. Interested candidates should contact Michael Hillstrom at (815) 479-7814 or mhillstrom@mchenry.edu.

Fascinated by anthropology? You can take classes from an expert right here at MCC! Learn more about MCC anthropology instructor Dr. Christopher Davis, his extensive experience in archaeoastronomy, and even his recent feature in a Netflix documentary at https://lnkd.in/g6ucDrZe. Then enroll in one of five anthropology classes this spring!
#Archaeology #Anthropology

Discover how Scrooge's transformation from miser to philanthropist can inspire your own holiday spirit on December 11 at MCC. Enjoy live music, refreshments, and a captivating presentation with Q&A. This event is free and open to the community.

Our first-year OTA students recently completed a challenging lab practical where they led a Sensory Bingo group therapy session. This experience helped them learn how to adapt interventions to meet the needs of clients with cognitive difficulties, a crucial skill for their upcoming Level I Fieldwork. Learn about the OTA program at our information session on December 10, at 3 p.m. in E217 or visit www.mchenry.edu/ota 
#FutureOTAs #OccupationalTherapy
